titlStmt.titl: Nasal Nitric Oxide Levels in Infants With and Without Congenital Heart Disease

citation.biblCit: Ryerson, Lindsay; Amirav, Israel; Bates, Angela; Mackie, Andrew; Leonard, Heather, 2016, "Nasal Nitric Oxide Levels in Infants With and Without Congenital Heart Disease", https://doi.org/10.7939/DVN/10919, UAL Dataverse, V2

titlStmt.titl: Nasal Nitric Oxide Levels in Infants With and Without Congenital Heart Disease
titlStmt.altTitl: Infant Nasal Nitric Oxide Levels in Congenital Heart Disease

stdyInfo.abstract: This pilot study aims to measure nasal nitric oxide (nNO) in a group of neonates and infants (less than 12 months) with congenital heart disease (CHD) and compare their nNO levels to age matched controls without CHD. CHD patients will be divided into subgroups, based on their cardiac anatomy, to try and identify a level of risk of ciliary dyskinesia within the subgroup of CHD. Each of these sub groups' nNO levels will be compared between groups and against age matched control infants wit hout CHD.

sumDscr.universe: Infants less than 1 year old with and without congenital heart disease (CHD).

dataColl.frequenc: Two samples will be taken five minutes apart.
dataColl.sampProc: The target total number of study participants is 120. 60 infants with congenital heart disease and 60 controls. 60 subjects with congenital heart disease will allow for at least three sub groups of cardiac anomalies with 20 subjects per group.
dataColl.collSitu: A member of the research team will ask the parent to measure the child's nasal NO level. The child's hospital number and age will be collected. For nNO assessment, an inert NO sampling line with a disposable foam olive will be placed into one of the subject's nostrils while the contralateral nostril is left open. Air will be sampled at a constant rate of 0.3 Liters/min from the nose by a chemiluminescent analyzer which provides measurement of the nNO level in parts per billion (ppb). All nNO measurements will be performed with the subjects supine. Measurements will be obtained using a nasal nitric oxide analyzer (CLD 88 sp).
dataColl.actMin: Two samples will be taken five minutes apart, to assess for test-retest reproducibility, with results for each patient being averaged over the two samples.
dataColl.cleanOps: Data was reviewed by principal investigators for completeness and accuracy.

setAvail.avlStatus: Data is not available because the study is still recruiting.

useStmt.restrctn: Given the small population size and risk of reidentification, no direct access will be provided to the data.
useStmt.conditions: Access to the data is limited to selected members of the research team.
